title: El Chapo's wife set to be released from halfway house following prison sentence
description: The wife of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman is set to be released from her California halfway house on Wednesday, according to prison records.

title: Georgia Gov. Kemp declares state of emergency over inflation
description: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp has declared a state of emergency in response to high inflation, blaming policies coming out of Washington, D.C.

title: BP chief executive Bernard Looney resigns over past relationships with colleagues
description: The chief executive of British energy giant BP has resigned after he accepted that he was not “fully transparent” in his disclosures about past relationships with colleagues

title: With thousands of child care programs at risk of closing, Democrats press for more money
description: Democrats push for a new round of money to keep the child care industry afloat.

title: 5 former Memphis officers indicted by federal grand jury in Tyre Nichols' death
description: Five former Memphis police officers have been indicted by a federal grand jury in connection with the death of Tyre Nichols.

title: University of Alabama condemns racist, homophobic slurs hurled at football game
description: The University of Alabama condemned racist and homophobic slurs hurled by fans of the Alabama Crimson Tide at Texas Longhorn players during Saturday night's game.

title: Infowars host Owen Shroyer gets 2 months behind bars in Capitol riot case
description: Infowars host Owen Shroyer has been sentenced to two months behind bars for joining the mob’s riot at the U.S. Capitol

title: Panel finds no single factor in horse deaths at Churchill Downs
description: A report from horse racing’s federally created oversight panel found no single cause of death among 12 horses at Churchill Downs this spring, but recommends further action and analysis to mitigate risk at the home of the Kentucky Derby

title: Child poverty in the US jumped and income declined in 2022 as pandemic benefits ended
description: Child poverty in the United States more than doubled and median household income declined last year when coronavirus pandemic-era government benefits expired and inflation kept rising

title: Jets QB Aaron Rodgers has torn left Achilles tendon, AP source says. He's likely to miss the season
description: A person familiar with the diagnosis says he has a torn left tendon.

title: WATCH:  Double rainbow appears in New York City skyline on 22nd anniversary of September 11
description: The two rainbows appeared just after a storm passed through New York state.

title: 8-year-old boy accidentally shot when barrel with guns inside set on fire
description: An 8-year-old Florida boy was accidentally shot when a burn barrel that had guns inside was set on fire, authorities said.

title: Cruise ship with 206 people runs aground in Greenland, no injuries, no damage
description: A Bahamas-flagged Norwegian cruise ship with 206 passengers and crew has run aground in northwestern Greenland

title: TikTok Shop launches in the US as company bets big on e-commerce
description: After months of testing, TikTok is fully launching its e-commerce product in the U.S., in an effort to translate the app’s cultural relevance among young consumers to sales

title: Imprisoned Iranian activist hospitalized as hunger strike reaches 13th day
description: Iranian human rights activist Bahareh Hedayat is experiencing dire health issues 12 days into her hunger strike in Tehran's notorious Evin Prison.

title: Judge says he is open to moving date of Trump's hush money trial
description: The New York judge overseeing former President Trump's hush money case has signaled he is open to moving the date of the trial, currently scheduled for March.

title: 12-year-old saves drowning man, credits CPR learned from 'Stranger Things'
description: A 12-year-old is credited for saving a drowning adult from a pool by using CPR.

title: WATCH:  Drone captures moment of American caver's rescue
description: A drone captured the moment American caver Mark Dickey was rescued after becoming trapped more than 3,300 feet underground for over a week in southern Turkey due to an illness.

title: McCarthy expected to endorse Biden impeachment inquiry
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy is expected to endorse an impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden, two sources told ABC News.

title: Spain strips deceased former Chilean President Pinochet of a Spanish military honor
description: Spain is stripping deceased former Chilean leader Gen. Augusto Pinochet of a Spanish military honor bestowed on him more than 40 years ago by the country’s former dictator, Gen. Francisco Franco

title: Grand Canyon hiker dies attempting to trek from south rim to north rim in single day
description: A Grand Canyon hiker has died while attempting to hike rim-to-rim in a single day at the national park.

title: Heavy rain brings flash flooding in parts of Massachusetts and Rhode Island
description: Heavy rainfall has flooded parts of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, with one city declaring a state of emergency as water poured into homes, creating moats around their foundations, and stranded drivers

title: 170 lbs of cocaine worth more than $2 million discovered in man's house
description: A 54-year-old man has been arrested after police said they searched his home and found approximately 170 lbs. of cocaine.

title: Train carrying Kim Jong Un enters Russia en route to meeting with Vladimir Putin
description: The bullet-proof train carrying Kim Jong Un crossed the border into Russia on Tuesday as the North Korean leader made his way to a summit with President Vladimir Putin.

title: House returns as McCarthy, McConnell at odds in government shutdown battle
description: The House returns Tuesday, and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy faces a looming government shutdown and a new leadership showdown -- this time with Mitch McConnell.

title: Taiwan says it spotted 22 Chinese warplanes and 20 warships near the island
description: Taiwan says it spotted 22 Chinese military aircraft and 20 warships near the island on Tuesday

title: DeSantis, visiting with 9/11 families, calls for 'transparency and accountability'
description: Ron DeSantis attended a 9/11 commemoration ceremony at ground zero in New York City on Monday, appearing with more than a dozen people who lost family on Sep. 11

title: Aaron Rodgers hurts ankle in first series for Jets, is carted off sideline and ruled out of game
description: Aaron Rodgers was injured on his fourth snap in his debut with the New York Jets, needing to be carted from the sideline with an ankle injury
